items.content_html: I found a headphone case whose brand name really gets at my peculiar affliction.
Based on this article, I predict that HBO is going to start to get a lot worse under its new ownership (AT&T). I hope I am wrong.

Salsas at my family’s favorite Mexican restaurant:

  • Queso: not hot
  • Verde: not hot
  • Ranchero: not hot
  • Guajillo: not hot
  • Arbol: way too hot!

Apple’s App Review rejected my new app, primarily because its name had the word “free” in it. While that’s not the end of the world, it will delay the app’s release for at least a couple days, as I figure out a new name and the best way to handle everything in App Store Connect.
Thomas Finch’s iOS 7+ Icon Generator is a nice, little utility. It takes a square app icon and masks it to match the rounded corner shape of modern iOS icons.

I’m happy to read a favorable review of “Ant-Man and the Wasp”. I’m apt to see it because I enjoy the Marvel Universe movies and because I’ve seen the commercial for it about 15,000 times during MLB.TV baseball games.

I love Assembly by Pixite. It’s an easy to use vector drawing app for iOS. Their new icon looks nice, but I will miss their cleverly designed bird icon. Luckily, it’s still on the app’s splash screen.
I just submitted a new iOS app to the App Store tonight. My fingers are crossed when it comes to the approval process. Hopefully nothing trips it up or anything. More details to come.
SwiftoDo 2.13.1 is now available in the App Store. It fixes a reverse-sort-order bug.
I’m happy today feels like a Thursday because all day yesterday felt like a Sunday.
It is too hot and muggy to do much of anything today. My family’s trip to the beach became a trip to lunch and then back home again.
App review and package delivery are on schedule today despite the holiday. I’m not upset, but it is unexpected.
These Master & Dynamic MH40 headphones are something special: premium materials, crystal clear sound, wide soundstage, and a unique bump in the bass range that I like more than I thought I would.
Were there scads of newspaper articles published I n 1935 about the file of radio (the day’s mass media) in the rise of fascism?
I suppose I will watch the Red Sox/Yankees series from the weekend, where the Yanks absolutely destroyed the Red Sox, but I really don’t want to.
I was finally smart enough today to bring the magnetic induction burner we never use outside to make pasta while I grilled ribeye and zucchini in the 95° heat.
I’m trying to get back on the MyFitnessPal horse today. I haven’t logged my food in six months and the results are really bad.
I finally got to see “A Quiet Place” this evening. What a excellent film! It is taut, suspenseful, and scary as hell.

My kids love the public library. My family had a nice trip there to get out of the heat today. It’s exciting now that my daughter is learning how to read. My son has enjoyed thumbing through books since he could sit up. Meanwhile, I only read on my iPad these days.

I would subscribe to Apple Music + News + TV for $149/year (or a little more for a family plan), but I’m a sucker for Apple products and services anyway. I would be a Texture subscriber today if their app experience wasn’t (in my opinion) terrible.

I think I will give Peter Davison-Reiber ‘s Fantastically Good Event Parser for Drafts 5 a try. Adding calendar entries with natural language without going through Fantastical or Calendars 5 sounds great to me.
The mail I definitely don’t need to open right away is always convening labeled for me. They could work on the wording, though.
This inexpensive little device works just fine for microwave popcorn. It amazes me that we used that awful bagged stuff for years.

items.title: As Kennedy Retires, the Supreme Court’s Attack on Labor Unions Is a Sign of Things to Come
items.content_html:
No kidding, The New Yorker, no kidding:

For years, conservatives complained about activist liberal judges making it up as they went along. Today, they are the activists. Under the guise of “originalism,” they are rewriting the nation’s laws to further the reactionary political agenda of the Republican Party and its biggest donors.

Note the scare quotes around “originalism”. It, like all the other -ism words we throw around—conservatism, liberalism, socialism— is completely devoid of meaning.

I have not been blogging as much recently because I have been disturbed so much by the onslaught of surprising and disturbing headlines here in the US. I honestly don’t know what to say anymore. I find joy in my family (they are great!!!) and almost nowhere else right now.
